channel.title: chamoglish on Hinanao-hu
channel.description: On a journey to learn Chamoru via blogging in Chamoru!

item.title: Magof P친sgua Nochebuena 2020
item.author: DJTai@pm.me (David J. Taitingfong)
item.description: H친fa adai todus hamyu yan Magof P친sgua Nochebuena para siha ni' ma침ilebra. Christmas time for me today has shifted mostly towards i bandan asagu친-hu.
item.content:encoded:
H친fa adai todus hamyu yan Magof P친sgua Nochebuena para siha ni' ma침ilebra.

Christmas time for me today has shifted mostly towards i bandan asagu친-hu. Gi minag친het, hagas ha' hu silebra Nochebuena yan i famili친-침a. On my side of the family we tend to split time between my dad’s side and my mom’s side. Even then, those parties tend to be closer to New Years or after, i.e., my family tends to celebrate Christmas after New Years — ya maolek-침a i “sales” dispues di New Years ki antes, hunggan? 游땐

Guaha bula hinasso-ku siha ginen tiempon Krismas yan i famili친-ku. It was definitely one of the happiest times of the year for me: bula nengk친nnu', gaigi todu mamprim친-hu gi gima', ya mang친nta yan manmanayuyut ham. Mah친lang yu' nu eyu tiempu.

I miss it - more so lately.

During Kasiyas 20201, guaha taotao ni' k친nta i kantan P친sgua Nochebuena. Muna’hasso yu' nu i famili친-ku. It had been so long since I’ve heard those songs - about a decade or so as of this writing. Growing up, it was a common sound…but after my dad’s mom passed, things changed. She was the one who always hosted I Nobenan Ni침o2. Si침a hu hunguk eyu na k친nta siha trabiha…: Fanm친tto Manhengge, Kant친yi Gui', O Patgon Belen, etc… Hearing them sing those songs inundated me with memories and I found myself wishing I had spent more time cherishing those moments; wishing I had pictures or footage; wishing my grandma was still alive and we could do i Nobenan Ni침o just one more time.

Hu tungu' na si침a hu bisita otro taotao ni' ma침ilebra i Nobenan Ni침o, lao ti parehu eyu yanggen taigui i famili친-ku. Ohala na gumaigi yu' yan i ma침ain친-hu lamo’na. Mah친lang yu' nu siha.

Todu ha' para p친’gu.

Bula guinaiya — DJT.

  1. Tinigi'-hu put Kasiyas 2020 ↩︎

  2. Guampedia article on Nobenan Ni침o ↩︎

item.title: Adingani i Lahi-hu
item.author: DJTai@pm.me (David J. Taitingfong)
item.description: Note: updated 2020-12-22 by removing reference to my since-deleted write.as blog. Most of the Chamoru that I’ve been using lately is towards i lahi-hu.
item.content:encoded:
Note: updated 2020-12-22 by removing reference to my since-deleted write.as blog.

Most of the Chamoru that I’ve been using lately is towards i lahi-hu. H친cha na s친kkan id친t-침a, pues inadingan-m친mi ni ti mapput.

I wanted to share some of those phrases with you and perhaps get some feedback. If you’re here then I’ll assume you came from Twitter, IG, or some other social media site. Feel free to hit me up on any of those.

Nihi ta tutuhun.

Sin친ngan Siha ni' Hu Sang친ni i Lahi-hu

Phrases I Tell My Son

Chamoru English
Nihi ta tulaika i mag친gu-mu Let’s change your clothes
Nihi ta h친nao Let’s go
H친nao! Huyung neni Go! Out neni
H친nao yan sodda' si nan친-mu Go and find your mom
H친fa bidad친-mu? What are you doing?
N친’i yu' nu gi kannai-mu Give me what’s in your hand
Kao 침친lang hao? Are you hungry?
Kao malagu' hao chumochu? Do you want to eat?
Kao h친spuk hao? Are you full?
Kao ma’o hao? Are you thirsty?
H친yi ennao/eyu? Who is that?
Maila' m친gi Come here
Nihi ta baila! Let’s dance!
Baila' yan guahu Dance with me
Mungnga mangassas hao fan Don’t scratch yourself please
Mungnga ennao Don’t do that
Mungnga kum친ti fan Please don’t cry
Sa' h친fa kum친kati hao neni? Why are you crying neni?
Atan yu' Look at me
Kao matuhuk hao? Are you sleepy?
Kao esta yayas hao? Are you already tired?

Definitely simple phrases that I hope my son will catch on to. Gi minag친het, hu tungu' na ha kumprendi na ilek-hu ya ennao ha gof na’magof yu'.

Todu ha' para p친’gu.

Bula guinaiya — DJT.
